data:
1
00:00:16,216 --> 00:00:18,878
First there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,886 --> 00:00:22,548
Then came
the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,889 --> 00:00:25,881
They were a race as old
as time itself.

4
00:00:26,559 --> 00:00:29,221
They had mastered
the ultimate technology...

5
00:00:29,562 --> 00:00:33,896
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,567 --> 00:00:37,900
They called this ability
"tuning."

7
00:00:38,571 --> 00:00:40,129
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,240 --> 00:00:42,902
Their civilization
was in decline...

9
00:00:43,243 --> 00:00:45,575
and so they abandoned
their world...

10
00:00:45,912 --> 00:00:49,245
seeking a cure for
their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,250 --> 00:00:53,583
Their endless journey brought
them to a small blue world...

12
00:00:53,920 --> 00:00:56,582
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy...

13
00:00:56,923 --> 00:00:59,255
our world.

14
00:00:59,592 --> 00:01:03,528
Here they thought they had finally
found what they had been searching for.

15
00:01:14,207 --> 00:01:17,870
My name is
Dr. Daniel Paul Schreber.

16
00:01:18,211 --> 00:01:20,873
I am just a man.
I help the Strangers...

17
00:01:21,548 --> 00:01:23,539
conduct their experiments.

18
00:01:24,217 --> 00:01:27,550
I have betrayed my own kind.

19
00:04:53,559 --> 00:04:56,221
You are confused,
aren't you? Frightened.

20
00:04:56,562 --> 00:04:58,223
That's all right. I can help you.

21
00:04:58,564 --> 00:05:01,158
- Who is this?
- I am a doctor. You must listen to me.

22
00:05:01,501 --> 00:05:05,733
There was an experiment.
Your memory was erased.

23
00:05:05,838 --> 00:05:08,830
- Do you understand me?
- What the hell is going on here?

24
00:05:09,175 --> 00:05:11,507
There are people coming
for you even as we speak.

25
00:05:11,844 --> 00:05:14,506
You must not let them find you.
You must leave now.

26
00:05:15,181 --> 00:05:18,173
Hello?
Are you there?

27
00:06:00,159 --> 00:06:03,822
Mr. Murdoch. The automat called.
Said you left your wallet there.

28
00:06:05,164 --> 00:06:08,497
I suggest you retrieve it
since you only paid for 3 weeks...

29
00:06:08,835 --> 00:06:11,167
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

30
00:06:12,505 --> 00:06:17,169
- I've been here 3 weeks?
- It's right there in black and white.

31
00:06:17,510 --> 00:06:19,501
Day and date.

32
00:06:19,846 --> 00:06:23,179
We make our books like our beds,
all neat and tidy.

33
00:06:23,516 --> 00:06:26,178
- I'll take care of it.
- See that you do.

34
00:06:26,519 --> 00:06:29,852
Only thing that makes you a guest
is cash on the barrelhead.

35
00:06:47,540 --> 00:06:50,202
House rules.
3 weeks is 3 weeks.

36
00:06:50,543 --> 00:06:53,205
No days off
for good behavior.

37
00:07:03,489 --> 00:07:05,480
Mr. Murdoch, yes...

38
00:07:05,825 --> 00:07:08,157
- Where is he?
- He just left...

39
00:07:08,828 --> 00:07:11,490
not 5 minutes ago.

40
00:07:12,165 --> 00:07:14,156
Sleep now.

41
00:07:16,502 --> 00:07:20,165
When the rumba rhythms
Start to play

42
00:07:20,506 --> 00:07:24,840
Dance with me
Make me sway

43
00:07:25,511 --> 00:07:29,174
Like a lazy ocean
Hugs the shore

44
00:07:29,515 --> 00:07:34,179
Hold me close
Sway me more

45
00:07:34,854 --> 00:07:38,517
Like a flower
Bending in the breeze

46
00:07:39,192 --> 00:07:43,856
Bend with me
Sway with ease

47
00:07:44,197 --> 00:07:47,860
When we dance
You have a way with me

48
00:07:48,534 --> 00:07:53,528
Stay with me
Sway with me

49
00:07:54,540 --> 00:07:58,772
Hey, sweetie! He said he was
your husband's doctor.

50
00:07:58,878 --> 00:08:01,472
He wanted to speak with you.

51
00:08:20,166 --> 00:08:21,827
Excuse me.

52
00:08:23,169 --> 00:08:25,501
- Dr...
- Schreber. Please.

53
00:08:26,172 --> 00:08:29,164
You must be Emma Murdoch.

54
00:08:30,176 --> 00:08:33,737
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

55
00:08:33,846 --> 00:08:37,179
- What is this?
- A rather crude experiment...

56
00:08:37,517 --> 00:08:40,850
- Designed to further my studies.
- I don't understand.

57
00:08:41,187 --> 00:08:43,519
You say you're my husband's doctor...

58
00:08:43,856 --> 00:08:46,188
- But he never mentioned you to me.
- The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch...

59
00:08:46,859 --> 00:08:49,521
John has been coming to
see me for quite some time.

60
00:08:49,862 --> 00:08:52,854
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

61
00:08:53,199 --> 00:08:55,861
stemming from your
marital difficulties.

62
00:08:56,202 --> 00:08:58,193
John told you what happened?

63
00:08:59,205 --> 00:09:01,696
When was the last time
that you saw him?

64
00:09:01,807 --> 00:09:05,140
3 weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

65
00:09:05,478 --> 00:09:09,141
- He was very angry at me.
- I understand how difficult...

66
00:09:09,482 --> 00:09:11,473
this must be. But for John's sake...

67
00:09:11,817 --> 00:09:14,149
I would like you to think
of me as your friend, Emma.

68
00:09:14,487 --> 00:09:17,820
It appears John has suffered
a psychotic break.

69
00:09:18,157 --> 00:09:21,149
- Complete memory loss.
- You can't be serious.

70
00:09:21,494 --> 00:09:24,395
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

71
00:09:24,497 --> 00:09:26,488
Even violent.

72
00:09:27,166 --> 00:09:30,499
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

73
00:09:30,836 --> 00:09:33,168
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

74
00:09:35,174 --> 00:09:36,664
for himself.

75
00:09:46,852 --> 00:09:51,186
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

76
00:09:51,524 --> 00:09:55,517
Mr. "j"- something... Murdoch?
J. Murdoch.

77
00:09:58,531 --> 00:10:02,524
What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

78
00:10:06,872 --> 00:10:08,863
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

79
00:10:09,208 --> 00:10:12,200
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

80
00:10:17,883 --> 00:10:19,874
Gotta get a grip on myself.

81
00:10:43,576 --> 00:10:46,238
I told the guy
cash on the barrelhead.

82
00:10:46,912 --> 00:10:50,245
I said, "listen,
3 weeks is 3 weeks."

83
00:10:50,583 --> 00:10:54,246
- Where's our lucky winner?
- Upstairs, sir, room 614.

84
00:10:55,254 --> 00:10:56,915
Another call girl.

85
00:10:57,590 --> 00:10:59,922
"J. Murdoch."

86
00:11:01,193 --> 00:11:02,524
Evening, Husselbeck.

87
00:11:02,862 --> 00:11:06,195
- Inspector Bumstead.
- Your lace is untied.

88
00:11:06,866 --> 00:11:08,527
Sir.

89
00:11:16,542 --> 00:11:20,444
Am I glad you're here. They say
Det. Walenski's got the heebie-jeebies.

90
00:11:20,546 --> 00:11:23,208
Just take what they give me.

91
00:11:56,248 --> 00:11:57,738
Excuse me.

92
00:11:59,418 --> 00:12:00,851
- Hello.
- Oh, it's you.

93
00:12:01,520 --> 00:12:04,182
- You left your wallet here, buddy.
- When did I do that?

94
00:12:04,523 --> 00:12:06,855
- When you was last here.
- When was that?

95
00:12:07,193 --> 00:12:10,526
When you left your wallet.
You expect me to remember?

96
00:12:13,532 --> 00:12:15,193
Hello.

97
00:12:15,868 --> 00:12:17,859
Excuse me.

98
00:12:18,204 --> 00:12:19,535
No, no, seriously.

99
00:12:35,888 --> 00:12:38,118
- Where you headed, chief?
- Home.

100
00:12:38,224 --> 00:12:41,887
- And where's home?
- Haven't you mugs got anything to do?

101
00:12:42,228 --> 00:12:44,458
Well, I'm just trying
to do my job, May.

102
00:12:44,563 --> 00:12:46,554
There's a killer out there...

103
00:12:46,899 --> 00:12:50,232
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels, huh?

104
00:12:52,571 --> 00:12:54,232
Get out of here.

105
00:13:02,848 --> 00:13:04,179
Come on.

106
00:13:07,520 --> 00:13:10,080
What's that make so far, Husselbeck?
6 hookers in all?

107
00:13:10,189 --> 00:13:13,181
- I believe so, sir.
- Give the man an "a" for effort.

108
00:13:18,531 --> 00:13:20,522
So, Husselbeck...

109
00:13:20,866 --> 00:13:23,528
what kind of killer
do you think...

110
00:13:23,869 --> 00:13:27,430
stops to save
a dying fish?

111
00:13:27,540 --> 00:13:30,532
- You've got me, sir.
- Bumstead, what took you?

112
00:13:30,876 --> 00:13:33,538
This killer's been running circles
around us, thanks to Walenski.

113
00:13:33,879 --> 00:13:38,213
With all due respect, I've known Eddie
a long time. He's a good cop.

114
00:13:38,884 --> 00:13:42,877
Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was
he let drift a long time ago.

115
00:13:43,222 --> 00:13:45,884
- Let me talk to Bumstead!
- Come on, hold it!

116
00:13:47,893 --> 00:13:49,554
Stop!
Frank, Frank!

117
00:13:52,231 --> 00:13:54,222
- Get his arm!
- On your feet.

118
00:13:54,900 --> 00:13:56,891
There's no way out!

119
00:13:57,236 --> 00:13:59,568
God, can you see?!

120
00:14:02,842 --> 00:14:05,834
Let me go, let me go!
I'm not gonna hurt you.

121
00:14:06,512 --> 00:14:08,844
- What was that?
- Walenski.

122
00:14:17,189 --> 00:14:20,181
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

123
00:14:20,526 --> 00:14:24,189
What did I ever do to inherit this?
Where do you begin?

124
00:14:24,530 --> 00:14:28,523
Everything detective Walenski
committed to paper should be here.

125
00:14:29,201 --> 00:14:31,863
He's the one that should be committed.

126
00:14:33,873 --> 00:14:36,865
Nothing like a little
healthy paranoia.

127
00:14:39,211 --> 00:14:41,202
Inspector Bumstead.

128
00:14:42,214 --> 00:14:45,775
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

129
00:14:45,885 --> 00:14:47,546
Take it to the front desk.

130
00:14:47,887 --> 00:14:50,549
They told me to come see you.

131
00:14:51,557 --> 00:14:54,219
His name's John Murdoch.

132
00:14:56,228 --> 00:14:59,561
Do these names
mean anything to you?

133
00:15:00,165 --> 00:15:04,499
Who are these women?
Why are you looking for my husband?

134
00:15:04,837 --> 00:15:07,397
- Are you going to accuse him?
- Maybe.

135
00:15:07,506 --> 00:15:10,498
- Murder.
- Whose murder?

136
00:15:11,510 --> 00:15:13,501
Which one?

137
00:15:13,846 --> 00:15:15,837
All of them.

138
00:15:16,181 --> 00:15:19,844
Mrs. Murdoch, I'm sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

139
00:15:20,185 --> 00:15:22,517
I'm sorry that I came.
Just both made a mistake.

140
00:15:22,855 --> 00:15:25,847
Please, if you'll just
give me half a second.

141
00:15:35,534 --> 00:15:37,195
Have we met before?

142
00:15:38,537 --> 00:15:41,768
If we did... I hope you're
still breathing.

143
00:15:41,874 --> 00:15:43,865
What's your name, honey?

144
00:15:44,543 --> 00:15:46,204
John.

145
00:15:46,879 --> 00:15:49,211
Well, that's an appropriate name.

146
00:15:56,555 --> 00:15:58,216
I was just thinking.

147
00:16:01,827 --> 00:16:03,158
What you do...

148
00:16:04,830 --> 00:16:07,162
seems kind of dangerous...

149
00:16:08,167 --> 00:16:11,728
right now. How do you know
I'm not the killer?

150
00:16:11,837 --> 00:16:14,829
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

151
00:16:15,841 --> 00:16:19,174
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

152
00:16:30,189 --> 00:16:31,850
Aw, shoot.

153
00:17:19,505 --> 00:17:23,168
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

154
00:17:23,509 --> 00:17:26,501
- Who are you?
- We might ask the same question.

155
00:17:27,846 --> 00:17:30,508
Sleep now.

156
00:17:56,208 --> 00:17:58,199
He can tune.

157
00:18:50,195 --> 00:18:53,187
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

158
00:18:53,532 --> 00:18:56,433
- It is said he is able to tune.
- Impossible.

159
00:18:56,535 --> 00:18:59,527
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

160
00:18:59,872 --> 00:19:02,363
On occasion the imprinting
does not take.

161
00:19:02,474 --> 00:19:05,136
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

162
00:19:05,477 --> 00:19:08,708
We find them wandering
like lost children.

163
00:19:08,814 --> 00:19:11,044
But this one was different, yes?

164
00:19:11,150 --> 00:19:14,813
- What has the doctor to say about this?
- He has failed to report in.

165
00:19:15,154 --> 00:19:18,055
- And Mr. Quick?
- No more Mr. Quick.

166
00:19:18,157 --> 00:19:20,489
Mr. Quick, dead, yes.

167
00:19:24,163 --> 00:19:26,825
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

168
00:19:27,166 --> 00:19:29,828
Mr. Book, does he know?

169
00:19:30,502 --> 00:19:33,494
Should we not know,
Mr. Hand?

170
00:19:33,839 --> 00:19:36,740
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

171
00:19:36,842 --> 00:19:39,504
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

172
00:19:39,845 --> 00:19:42,507
We must have this man.

173
00:19:47,853 --> 00:19:49,844
My brand, I hope.

174
00:20:01,200 --> 00:20:03,862
I've been so worried about you.

175
00:20:06,872 --> 00:20:08,772
Are you punishing me?

176
00:20:08,874 --> 00:20:11,536
You know, if disappearing
is your way of punishing me...

177
00:20:11,877 --> 00:20:14,209
- I don't appreciate it.
- I don't know what you're talking about.

178
00:20:17,549 --> 00:20:21,542
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

179
00:20:23,222 --> 00:20:26,555
- You supposed to be my wife?
- Supposed to be?

180
00:20:29,561 --> 00:20:34,225
You really... don't know
who I am, do you?

181
00:20:34,566 --> 00:20:36,898
Your doctor called me.
He was worried this might happen.

182
00:20:37,236 --> 00:20:38,567
My doctor?

183
00:20:38,904 --> 00:20:44,570
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

184
00:20:46,912 --> 00:20:48,573
Schreber.

185
00:20:52,918 --> 00:20:56,479
I feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

186
00:20:56,588 --> 00:21:00,183
- Why was I seeing a doctor?
- I had an affair.

187
00:21:01,860 --> 00:21:04,522
You were angry at me.

188
00:21:06,198 --> 00:21:09,861
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

189
00:21:16,875 --> 00:21:19,207
Dr. Schreber.

190
00:21:19,544 --> 00:21:24,208
How most unfortunate it is that we
were forced to seek you out here.

191
00:21:25,217 --> 00:21:29,551
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

192
00:21:30,222 --> 00:21:33,453
- I'm sorry. I...
- Failed to report in, yes.

193
00:21:33,558 --> 00:21:36,220
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

194
00:21:36,561 --> 00:21:39,894
You weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

195
00:21:40,232 --> 00:21:42,894
We found this
in his hotel room.

196
00:21:43,235 --> 00:21:46,227
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

197
00:21:46,571 --> 00:21:49,904
I tried to imprint him, but he woke up.
He knocked the syringe.

198
00:21:50,575 --> 00:21:53,567
- He has no memories, then?
- Only fragments.

199
00:21:53,912 --> 00:21:57,905
The procedure, it was interrupted.
It's a matter of rounding him up.

200
00:21:58,917 --> 00:22:02,512
- You have had strays before, right?
- This is no stray, doctor.

201
00:22:03,188 --> 00:22:05,850
- This one can tune.
- But that's impossible.

202
00:22:06,191 --> 00:22:09,183
- I thought only you had that ability.
- You will process...

203
00:22:09,528 --> 00:22:12,088
another template of
the subject's memories, yes?

204
00:22:12,197 --> 00:22:14,529
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

205
00:22:15,200 --> 00:22:18,533
No. We require them
for a quite different purpose.

206
00:22:18,870 --> 00:22:21,202
It's almost midnight, Dr. Schreber.

207
00:22:21,540 --> 00:22:23,531
We'll talk again
after tonight's tuning...

208
00:22:24,209 --> 00:22:26,439
but no more delays, yes?

209
00:22:26,545 --> 00:22:32,211
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

210
00:22:32,884 --> 00:22:35,546
- The police are looking for you.
- I know.

211
00:22:35,887 --> 00:22:39,550
I saw the papers. "Killer stalks
city streetwalkers."

212
00:22:42,894 --> 00:22:45,226
I was with
one of those women...

213
00:22:46,565 --> 00:22:49,898
- Before I came here tonight.
- I don't understand.

214
00:22:50,235 --> 00:22:53,136
I met her
outside an automat.

215
00:22:53,238 --> 00:22:56,230
I guess I wanted to test myself.

216
00:22:56,908 --> 00:23:00,173
I wanted to know if I had it in me
to do those things.

217
00:23:00,512 --> 00:23:04,846
Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever
I am, I'm not a killer.

218
00:23:10,856 --> 00:23:12,847
I believe you.

219
00:23:14,192 --> 00:23:16,183
You do?

220
00:23:20,866 --> 00:23:23,528
The car outside...
the one you arrived in.

221
00:23:23,869 --> 00:23:26,861
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

222
00:23:28,206 --> 00:23:30,868
I didn't know
he was still here.

223
00:23:33,211 --> 00:23:35,543
Hold it right there, mister!

224
00:23:36,882 --> 00:23:40,443
- Wait. You have the wrong man.
- Stand aside, will you please?

225
00:23:40,552 --> 00:23:44,113
- I didn't kill anyone.
- Right now what you are is a suspect.

226
00:23:44,222 --> 00:23:47,453
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

227
00:23:47,559 --> 00:23:49,550
You're not gonna believe.

228
00:23:50,562 --> 00:23:53,554
- Try me.
- There's someone after me.

229
00:23:54,232 --> 00:23:57,224
There's this group of men.
They want me dead.

230
00:23:57,569 --> 00:24:00,163
And I don't even know...
they're not even...

231
00:24:00,839 --> 00:24:04,502
- Who's gonna listen to a madman?
- Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.

232
00:24:04,843 --> 00:24:06,174
Run!

233
00:24:09,848 --> 00:24:12,180
No one ever listens to me.

234
00:24:18,190 --> 00:24:20,181
Murdoch, stop!

235
00:25:01,833 --> 00:25:04,825
- How much further?
- We're almost there, buddy.

236
00:25:06,838 --> 00:25:11,172
- You know the way to Shell Beach?
- You're kidding.

237
00:25:11,510 --> 00:25:13,501
We spent our honeymoon there.

238
00:25:13,845 --> 00:25:16,177
You just take main street west to...

239
00:25:18,517 --> 00:25:20,508
or is it the cross...

240
00:25:20,852 --> 00:25:22,513
you know, that's funny.

241
00:25:22,854 --> 00:25:26,187
I can't seem to remember if it's main
street west or the cross-town.

242
00:25:30,862 --> 00:25:33,854
I'm sorry, inspector, I cannot be
of more assistance...

243
00:25:34,199 --> 00:25:38,533
- But I am running late.
- I appreciate your taking the time.

244
00:25:46,878 --> 00:25:49,210
Just one thing puzzles me.

245
00:25:49,548 --> 00:25:53,780
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

246
00:25:53,885 --> 00:25:56,786
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

247
00:25:56,888 --> 00:26:00,051
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

248
00:26:00,158 --> 00:26:03,491
- I know when someone is lying to me.
- Inspector...

249
00:26:03,828 --> 00:26:06,820
judging personalities
happens to be my business.

250
00:26:07,165 --> 00:26:10,157
- Maybe you could give me a few pointers.
- Certainly.

251
00:26:10,835 --> 00:26:12,826
Let's take you, for instance.

252
00:26:13,171 --> 00:26:16,163
You are a fastidious man,
driven...

253
00:26:16,508 --> 00:26:18,738
consumed by details.

254
00:26:18,843 --> 00:26:20,743
I would say your life...

255
00:26:20,845 --> 00:26:24,838
is rather lonely. Good evening,
inspector. I really must be going.

256
00:27:02,487 --> 00:27:03,476
Come in.

257
00:27:08,493 --> 00:27:10,825
- How is he?
- The same.

258
00:27:11,830 --> 00:27:14,822
Walenski.
It's me, Frank.

259
00:27:20,505 --> 00:27:22,166
Come in, Frank.

260
00:27:25,176 --> 00:27:27,167
Close the door.

261
00:27:34,519 --> 00:27:39,513
I've been looking through your
old reports. Interesting case.

262
00:27:41,192 --> 00:27:44,525
The kind that can make
a man's career...

263
00:27:46,197 --> 00:27:47,755
or break it.

264
00:27:47,866 --> 00:27:51,199
- I was on that case.
- And then what?

265
00:27:52,203 --> 00:27:55,195
- What happened then?
- Nothing happened, Frank.

266
00:27:56,207 --> 00:28:00,041
I've just been spending time
on the subway riding in circles.

267
00:28:00,145 --> 00:28:02,477
Thinking in circles.

268
00:28:02,814 --> 00:28:04,475
There's no way out.

269
00:28:05,817 --> 00:28:08,479
I've been over every
inch of this city.

270
00:28:12,157 --> 00:28:15,820
- You're scaring your wife to death.
- She's not my wife.

271
00:28:17,162 --> 00:28:20,063
I don't know who she is.
I don't know who any of us are.

272
00:28:20,165 --> 00:28:24,158
- What makes you say that?
- Do you think about the past much?

273
00:28:25,837 --> 00:28:27,498
As much as the next guy.

274
00:28:28,173 --> 00:28:30,733
See, I've been trying
to remember things...

275
00:28:30,842 --> 00:28:33,504
from my past.

276
00:28:34,179 --> 00:28:38,843
But the more I try to think back
the more it all starts to unravel.

277
00:28:39,184 --> 00:28:41,516
None of it seems real.
It's like...

278
00:28:41,853 --> 00:28:44,754
I've just been
dreaming this life...

279
00:28:44,856 --> 00:28:47,757
and when I finally wake up
I'll be somebody else.

280
00:28:47,859 --> 00:28:50,521
Somebody
totally different.

281
00:28:54,532 --> 00:29:00,129
You saw something, didn't you, Eddie?
Something to do with the case.

282
00:29:00,805 --> 00:29:03,797
There is no case.
There never was!

283
00:29:04,142 --> 00:29:08,806
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

284
00:29:49,187 --> 00:29:52,850
Tonight's requirements
are 12 family photo albums...

285
00:29:53,525 --> 00:29:57,859
9 personal diaries...
17 love letters...

286
00:29:58,196 --> 00:30:01,188
assorted childhood photographs...

287
00:30:05,203 --> 00:30:07,194
These do bring back memories.

288
00:30:09,874 --> 00:30:12,206
This one is still warm.

289
00:30:12,877 --> 00:30:17,211
What is it? The recollections
of a great lover?

290
00:30:17,549 --> 00:30:21,542
A catalog of conquests?
You'll soon find out.

291
00:30:23,221 --> 00:30:27,783
You wouldn't appreciate that,
would you, Mr. whatever your name is.

292
00:30:27,892 --> 00:30:31,885
Not the sort of conquests
you would ever understand.

293
00:30:33,231 --> 00:30:34,892
Let's see.

294
00:30:35,900 --> 00:30:38,232
A touch of unhappy childhood.

295
00:30:43,908 --> 00:30:46,570
A dash of teenage
rebellion.

296
00:30:48,246 --> 00:30:49,907
And last, but not least...

297
00:30:50,915 --> 00:30:54,578
- A tragic death in the family.
- Doctor.

298
00:30:56,921 --> 00:30:58,582
Mr. Book.

299
00:31:05,196 --> 00:31:08,859
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the tuning as the others do?

300
00:31:09,200 --> 00:31:13,432
I don't know. Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

301
00:31:13,538 --> 00:31:16,200
A freak of nature.
He's adapted to survive.

302
00:31:16,541 --> 00:31:21,205
Weren't you looking for the human soul?
That's the purpose of your little zoo.

303
00:31:22,213 --> 00:31:25,444
That's why you keep changing people
and things around every night.

304
00:31:25,550 --> 00:31:28,212
Maybe you have finally found
what you are looking for...

305
00:31:28,553 --> 00:31:29,884
and it's going to bite you on your...

306
00:31:33,558 --> 00:31:37,460
It requires several of your lifetimes
to master our gifts.

307
00:31:37,562 --> 00:31:41,123
The idea that a simple man
could develop the ability to tune...

308
00:31:41,232 --> 00:31:45,225
is absurd, I know, but what other
explanation is there?

309
00:31:49,574 --> 00:31:51,565
It is time.

310
00:32:36,888 --> 00:32:37,877
Shut it down.

311
00:32:57,241 --> 00:33:00,176
Frederickson says he'll take me
off the damn night shift soon.

312
00:33:00,511 --> 00:33:02,843
Well, it's about time, dear.

313
00:33:52,897 --> 00:33:54,228
Hello?

314
00:33:56,234 --> 00:33:58,225
Hello?!

315
00:34:01,839 --> 00:34:03,170
Wake up.

316
00:34:06,511 --> 00:34:08,172
Wake up!

317
00:34:08,513 --> 00:34:09,844
Wake up!

318
00:34:11,849 --> 00:34:13,510
Wake up!

319
00:34:17,855 --> 00:34:20,847
Can anybody hear me?!

320
00:34:23,528 --> 00:34:26,190
Let the tuning commence.

321
00:37:06,157 --> 00:37:09,149
The Goodwins.
Jeremy, Sylvia...

322
00:37:09,827 --> 00:37:12,159
Jane and little Matthew.

323
00:37:15,499 --> 00:37:18,161
Jane and little Matthew.

324
00:37:47,865 --> 00:37:49,856
The rich get richer.

325
00:37:50,201 --> 00:37:54,194
Probably have maid's quarters
before the night is through.

326
00:38:47,191 --> 00:38:49,421
Dr. Schreber,
I presume.

327
00:38:49,527 --> 00:38:51,518
- It's you.
- Hey, come on.

328
00:38:52,196 --> 00:38:55,757
That's no way to greet a patient, doc.
If that's what you are, huh, doctor?

329
00:38:55,866 --> 00:38:58,426
- Mr. Murdoch, please...
- What is happening here?

330
00:38:58,536 --> 00:39:01,471
- Why is everyone asleep?
- Keep your voice down.

331
00:39:01,806 --> 00:39:03,797
Why can't I remember anything?
What have you done to me?

332
00:39:04,141 --> 00:39:07,804
Nothing. please, I want to help you.
We can't talk here.

333
00:39:08,145 --> 00:39:10,477
- It's not safe. If they see us...
- I don't care.

334
00:39:10,815 --> 00:39:13,807
I want some answers now!
Who are they?

335
00:39:14,151 --> 00:39:16,051
Why are they trying to kill me?

336
00:39:16,153 --> 00:39:17,814
Answer me!

337
00:39:22,159 --> 00:39:25,151
My God. You really can do it.

338
00:39:25,496 --> 00:39:29,057
- I did that?
- You have their power.

339
00:39:29,166 --> 00:39:32,499
You can make things happen by will
alone. They call it tuning.

340
00:39:32,837 --> 00:39:34,828
That's how they make the changes.

341
00:39:35,172 --> 00:39:37,072
Just now you acted out of
self defense. A reflex.

342
00:39:37,174 --> 00:39:40,166
But I can teach you to control
your power consciously.

343
00:39:40,511 --> 00:39:44,174
Let me help you. Together we can
stop them. We can take the city back.

344
00:39:47,184 --> 00:39:48,515
My glasses.

345
00:39:50,521 --> 00:39:52,853
My glasses, please.

346
00:40:43,574 --> 00:40:45,906
He made a terrible
impression for the firm...

347
00:40:46,243 --> 00:40:48,575
lollygagging around as he did.

348
00:40:48,913 --> 00:40:51,814
So I simply told Frederickson
I was going to have to let him go.

349
00:40:51,916 --> 00:40:53,907
And well you should have, darling.

350
00:40:54,585 --> 00:40:57,577
He attacked me.
I don't know where he has gone.

351
00:40:58,255 --> 00:41:03,192
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do. Yes?

352
00:41:07,198 --> 00:41:12,534
They say that you're
A run-around lover

353
00:41:14,538 --> 00:41:17,530
Though you say

354
00:41:18,542 --> 00:41:21,534
It isn't so

355
00:41:25,216 --> 00:41:30,552
But if you put me down
For another

356
00:41:33,891 --> 00:41:37,884
I'll know
Believe me

357
00:41:38,229 --> 00:41:40,561
I'll know

358
00:41:41,565 --> 00:41:44,898
Tonight's experiment shall be conducted
in the following locations.

359
00:41:45,236 --> 00:41:48,467
The first subject
shall be imprinted here...

360
00:41:48,572 --> 00:41:51,905
- On avenue M.
- Mr. Book, there is a problem.

361
00:41:52,576 --> 00:41:55,477
- There is no avenue M.
- We were unable to complete it.

362
00:41:55,579 --> 00:41:58,912
During the last tuning
we detected a lack of control.

363
00:41:59,250 --> 00:42:02,185
An opposing influence
on the machines?

364
00:42:02,520 --> 00:42:06,513
Then this man Murdoch
is more powerful than we thought.

365
00:42:06,857 --> 00:42:08,848
He's becoming
like us.

366
00:42:09,193 --> 00:42:12,754
So we must become
like him.

367
00:42:12,863 --> 00:42:15,093
The good doctor
has done as we asked?

368
00:42:15,199 --> 00:42:19,863
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume 2.

369
00:42:21,205 --> 00:42:26,871
We must not do this. Murdoch does not
possess these memories, yes?

370
00:42:27,211 --> 00:42:30,203
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

371
00:42:30,548 --> 00:42:34,780
Everywhere he goes, everyone he seeks
out will be known to us.

372
00:42:34,885 --> 00:42:37,217
And as he follows
the clues...

373
00:42:37,555 --> 00:42:39,887
so shall we follow the memories.

374
00:42:40,224 --> 00:42:42,784
But to imprint
one of us.

375
00:42:42,893 --> 00:42:45,123
Failure has always resulted.

376
00:42:45,229 --> 00:42:48,892
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

377
00:42:49,233 --> 00:42:50,564
Imprint.

378
00:42:55,906 --> 00:42:58,238
This may sting a bit.

379
00:43:33,877 --> 00:43:35,538
Is it done?

380
00:43:35,879 --> 00:43:37,870
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

381
00:43:38,215 --> 00:43:41,548
I have John Murdoch...
in mind.

382
00:43:42,553 --> 00:43:44,214
"Johnny...

383
00:43:44,555 --> 00:43:47,888
I found this postcard
among your mother's things.

384
00:43:48,225 --> 00:43:51,558
Brings back memories,
doesn't it? Stop by sometime.

385
00:43:51,895 --> 00:43:55,456
We'll see if we can't hook
ourselves another mermaid.

386
00:43:55,566 --> 00:43:58,228
love to Emma.
Karl."

387
00:44:06,510 --> 00:44:08,171
Karl Harris.

388
00:44:16,186 --> 00:44:17,847
Harris.

389
00:44:21,859 --> 00:44:23,850
"Harris Karl."

390
00:44:25,863 --> 00:44:28,525
Excuse me. Can you tell
me the way to Avenue C?

391
00:44:28,866 --> 00:44:30,857
Try the subway.

392
00:44:33,871 --> 00:44:37,864
- You got a problem, pal?
- You been working here long?

393
00:44:38,208 --> 00:44:42,542
25 years. No days off
for good behavior.

394
00:45:06,503 --> 00:45:08,835
We're looking for John Murdoch.

395
00:45:43,874 --> 00:45:47,867
- She knows nothing, Mr. Hand.
- A dead end, yes, Mr. Wall.

396
00:45:48,212 --> 00:45:50,544
We thought his imprint would
allow us to track him, yes...

397
00:45:50,881 --> 00:45:53,111
but instead we have
been brought here.

398
00:45:53,217 --> 00:45:57,119
- This is irrational.
- Instincts are irrational.

399
00:45:57,221 --> 00:46:00,156
And we must follow where they lead.

400
00:46:00,491 --> 00:46:04,052
Mr. Sleep suggests he
may go to places familiar...

401
00:46:04,161 --> 00:46:07,062
- His job.
- He does not care about our job.

402
00:46:07,164 --> 00:46:09,826
Indulge us,
Mr. Hand.

403
00:46:10,167 --> 00:46:11,828
If you were Murdoch...

404
00:46:12,169 --> 00:46:16,162
If... I were Murdoch...

405
00:46:17,841 --> 00:46:19,502
I would remember...

406
00:46:19,843 --> 00:46:23,836
how my wife had hurt me
by sleeping with another man.

407
00:46:25,182 --> 00:46:26,843
And then...

408
00:46:28,519 --> 00:46:32,512
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

409
00:46:35,192 --> 00:46:37,854
Leave me alone with her.

410
00:46:38,195 --> 00:46:40,186
There's work to be done.

411
00:46:43,200 --> 00:46:45,862
All change, platform 3.

412
00:46:46,203 --> 00:46:48,865
- Platform 3, all change.
- All change?

413
00:46:49,206 --> 00:46:51,197
Excuse me. How do I get
to the end of the line?

414
00:46:51,542 --> 00:46:53,203
You want the express.

415
00:47:06,490 --> 00:47:09,482
- How come that train didn't stop?
- That's the express.

416
00:47:10,828 --> 00:47:12,819
There's no way out, you know?

417
00:47:13,163 --> 00:47:16,155
You can't get out of the city.
Believe me, I've tried.

418
00:47:16,500 --> 00:47:20,163
You're Murdoch, aren't you?
The one they've been looking for.

419
00:47:20,504 --> 00:47:22,062
You're not a killer.

420
00:47:22,172 --> 00:47:26,074
They set you up with a fake identity,
like everyone else in this place.

421
00:47:26,176 --> 00:47:28,508
- Who are you?
- Used to be a cop.

422
00:47:28,846 --> 00:47:33,510
At least, in this life, I was.
They steal people's memories, you know?

423
00:47:34,184 --> 00:47:38,518
Then they swap them around between us.
I've seen them do it...

424
00:47:38,856 --> 00:47:41,188
till no one knows who they are anymore.

425
00:47:41,525 --> 00:47:44,085
- How do you know all this?
- Once in a while, one of us wakes up...

426
00:47:44,194 --> 00:47:46,526
while they're changing things.

427
00:47:46,864 --> 00:47:50,527
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does. It happened to me.

428
00:47:51,535 --> 00:47:53,867
They'll come looking for you.

429
00:47:54,204 --> 00:47:56,536
Just like they'll come looking for me.

430
00:47:56,874 --> 00:48:00,139
But that's OK.
I figured a way out.

431
00:48:10,487 --> 00:48:12,478
They were here.

432
00:48:13,490 --> 00:48:17,824
- Last night.
- This was to be his home.

433
00:48:20,163 --> 00:48:23,826
- That was when we loved her.
- This is all well and good...

434
00:48:24,167 --> 00:48:28,831
but we require a more practical link
to his present whereabouts.

435
00:48:31,174 --> 00:48:35,167
And I know where to find her.

436
00:48:43,854 --> 00:48:47,847
- We're lucky, if you think about it.
- I'm sorry?

437
00:48:48,191 --> 00:48:52,525
To be able to revisit those places
which have meant so very much to us.

438
00:48:52,863 --> 00:48:55,423
I thought it was more
that we were haunted by them.

439
00:48:55,532 --> 00:48:57,090
Perhaps.

440
00:48:57,200 --> 00:49:01,136
There used to be a ferry when I was a
boy, biggest thing you ever saw.

441
00:49:01,805 --> 00:49:05,468
Lit up like a floating
birthday cake.

442
00:49:06,143 --> 00:49:10,477
That's just what my husband
once said to me on this very spot.

443
00:49:11,815 --> 00:49:15,478
- Where is your husband now?
- I wish I knew.

444
00:49:16,153 --> 00:49:20,487
- What brings you here?
- I met my wife at this place.

445
00:49:20,824 --> 00:49:24,817
- It's where I first met my husband.
- Small world.

446
00:50:18,548 --> 00:50:19,879
Hello?

447
00:50:20,550 --> 00:50:22,211
Hello?

448
00:51:06,863 --> 00:51:10,526
- What are you doing here?
- I've been following you.

449
00:51:14,204 --> 00:51:15,865
Hold it right there!

450
00:51:17,874 --> 00:51:19,865
Johnny?

451
00:51:22,546 --> 00:51:26,539
I thought you'd forgotten
your uncle Karl.

452
00:51:26,883 --> 00:51:29,215
You son of a gun!

453
00:51:31,555 --> 00:51:33,546
Karl?

454
00:51:35,892 --> 00:51:37,553
Wait.

455
00:51:39,896 --> 00:51:41,227
Is that me?

456
00:51:50,574 --> 00:51:53,566
- Shell Beach is where I grew up?
- That's what I said.

457
00:51:53,910 --> 00:51:58,574
- Shell Beach, your hometown.
- How do I get there?

458
00:51:59,916 --> 00:52:02,851
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

459
00:52:03,186 --> 00:52:05,848
You must remember.
You gotta have some idea.

460
00:52:06,189 --> 00:52:09,181
- Come on!
- Sorry, Johnny.

461
00:52:10,193 --> 00:52:13,526
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

462
00:52:16,867 --> 00:52:20,530
- So bright there.
- Brighter times, I guess.

463
00:52:22,205 --> 00:52:25,197
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

464
00:52:25,542 --> 00:52:27,442
That's me and your pa.

465
00:52:27,544 --> 00:52:29,444
What a couple of handsome fools.

466
00:52:29,546 --> 00:52:31,537
What happened to my parents?

467
00:52:33,216 --> 00:52:35,207
Where are they now?

468
00:52:35,886 --> 00:52:40,220
They're dead. They died when
their house burned down.

469
00:52:40,557 --> 00:52:44,891
I looked after you.
You don't remember that, really?

470
00:52:47,898 --> 00:52:49,456
What's that?

471
00:52:49,566 --> 00:52:51,227
What is that?

472
00:52:55,906 --> 00:52:57,464
What's the scar?

473
00:52:57,574 --> 00:53:00,509
You burnt your arm
pretty bad in the fire.

474
00:53:05,515 --> 00:53:09,508
- What does it mean?
- It means these are all lies!

475
00:53:13,523 --> 00:53:15,753
My husband told me
he'd been here.

476
00:53:15,859 --> 00:53:18,521
He told me he wanted to test himself...

477
00:53:18,862 --> 00:53:21,854
See if he was...
capable of...

478
00:53:32,542 --> 00:53:36,535
I wanted to talk to her.
Maybe she could help me find him.

479
00:53:38,215 --> 00:53:41,207
Stay here. I'm gonna
call the station.

480
00:53:56,233 --> 00:53:57,894
It's beautiful.

481
00:53:59,903 --> 00:54:04,840
It was a gift from my mother.
She died recently.

482
00:54:05,842 --> 00:54:08,504
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

483
00:54:10,180 --> 00:54:11,511
I'm sorry.

484
00:54:14,851 --> 00:54:20,517
It's a funny thing, though. I can't
remember when she gave it to me.

485
00:54:21,858 --> 00:54:25,521
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

486
00:54:26,196 --> 00:54:30,860
- What's happening, inspector?
- I'm not sure I know anymore.

487
00:54:34,204 --> 00:54:39,198
I left your old room like it was.
You can sleep here tonight, huh?

488
00:54:39,542 --> 00:54:43,205
Glad to have you back, Johnny...
even if it is for just a night.

489
00:54:45,215 --> 00:54:47,206
- Is that the right time?
- Why, sure.

490
00:54:47,884 --> 00:54:51,877
- That clock's kept perfect time.
- A.m. or p.m.?

491
00:54:53,223 --> 00:54:55,783
- What do you think, Johnny?
- I don't understand.

492
00:54:55,892 --> 00:54:58,554
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

493
00:54:58,895 --> 00:55:01,489
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

494
00:55:02,832 --> 00:55:07,166
Get some sleep. We'll straighten
all this out tomorrow.

495
00:55:32,862 --> 00:55:36,195
"Guide to Shell Beach
by Johnny Murdoch."

496
00:55:38,868 --> 00:55:40,859
Oh, come on.

497
00:55:59,222 --> 00:56:01,713
- Hello.
- Emma, he's here.

498
00:56:01,825 --> 00:56:04,157
- He's acting mighty peculiar.
- I know.

499
00:56:04,494 --> 00:56:08,157
He's not himself. Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

500
00:56:08,498 --> 00:56:10,830
- I'll try.
- Thanks, Karl. Bye.

501
00:56:13,837 --> 00:56:17,500
I can't promise anything.
We just have to play it as it comes.

502
00:56:17,841 --> 00:56:20,833
Johnny... we just wanted to help.

503
00:56:27,517 --> 00:56:30,850
Karl. Uncle Karl.

504
00:56:31,187 --> 00:56:35,180
If you're in some kind of trouble
maybe we could do something.

505
00:56:36,192 --> 00:56:38,854
Haven't seen you in so long.

506
00:57:52,869 --> 00:57:57,533
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

507
00:58:02,145 --> 00:58:04,807
- Start talking.
- There's no need for this.

508
00:58:05,148 --> 00:58:08,140
There's no escape. The city's ours.
We made it.

509
00:58:08,485 --> 00:58:10,043
What are you talking about?

510
00:58:10,153 --> 00:58:13,054
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories...

511
00:58:13,156 --> 00:58:16,717
different eras, different
pasts, all rolled into one.

512
00:58:16,826 --> 00:58:20,819
Each night, we revise it, refine it
in order to learn.

513
00:58:21,164 --> 00:58:23,155
- Learn what?
- About you...

514
00:58:23,833 --> 00:58:26,165
you and your fellow inhabitants...

515
00:58:26,503 --> 00:58:29,495
- What makes you human.
- Why?!

516
00:58:29,839 --> 00:58:32,501
We need to be like you.

517
00:58:32,842 --> 00:58:37,404
I understand you now. I remember
that which you do not...

518
00:58:37,514 --> 00:58:40,847
what you've been missing.
The ocean, yes...

519
00:58:41,518 --> 00:58:43,850
running along the waves
as a child...

520
00:58:44,187 --> 00:58:48,521
meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

521
00:58:49,859 --> 00:58:52,851
- What are you?
- You've seen what we are.

522
00:58:53,196 --> 00:58:55,858
We use your dead
as vessels.

523
01:01:04,861 --> 01:01:05,850
Get in!

524
01:01:21,544 --> 01:01:25,446
- What about her? Ring any bells?
- She was alive when I left her.

525
01:01:25,548 --> 01:01:27,880
- What about this?
- This is nothing. I...

526
01:01:28,217 --> 01:01:31,880
it must mean something,
all those pictures.

527
01:01:33,890 --> 01:01:35,881
- I don't understand this.
- Stop playing games with me!

528
01:01:36,225 --> 01:01:38,785
- Stop telling me lies!
- I am not telling you lies!

529
01:01:38,895 --> 01:01:43,127
Help me out here. Make me understand.
I have this jigsaw puzzle...

530
01:01:43,232 --> 01:01:46,224
and every time I try to rearrange
the pieces it doesn't make any sense.

531
01:01:46,569 --> 01:01:49,902
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm in the dark here.

532
01:01:50,239 --> 01:01:51,900
You let me ask you a question?

533
01:01:52,241 --> 01:01:54,141
You heard of a place called
Shell Beach?

534
01:01:54,243 --> 01:01:55,904
Know how to get there?

535
01:01:56,579 --> 01:01:58,570
- Can you tell me?
- Right.

536
01:01:58,915 --> 01:02:01,509
You go to the...

537
01:02:02,518 --> 01:02:05,180
- Where do you go?
- Just give me a second.

538
01:02:06,522 --> 01:02:10,856
You can't remember, can you?
You think that's kind of odd?

539
01:02:13,196 --> 01:02:15,187
I got a better one for you.

540
01:02:15,531 --> 01:02:19,524
When was the last time you remember
doing something during the day?

541
01:02:19,869 --> 01:02:22,861
- What do you mean?
- I just mean... during the day.

542
01:02:24,207 --> 01:02:27,108
Daylight. When was the last time
you remember seeing it?

543
01:02:27,210 --> 01:02:30,873
And I'm not talking about some
distant childhood memory.

544
01:02:31,214 --> 01:02:33,876
I mean like yesterday?
Last week? When?

545
01:02:34,217 --> 01:02:36,549
Can you come up with a single memory?

546
01:02:37,887 --> 01:02:41,220
You can't, can you?
I don't think the sun even...

547
01:02:42,225 --> 01:02:45,217
exists... in this place.

548
01:02:45,561 --> 01:02:48,121
'Cause I've been up for
hours and hours...

549
01:02:48,231 --> 01:02:51,223
- And the night never ends here.
- That is crazy.

550
01:02:51,567 --> 01:02:53,899
You're damn right
this is crazy.

551
01:02:54,237 --> 01:02:57,229
It's not just me.
It's all of us.

552
01:02:57,573 --> 01:03:00,838
- They're doing something to all of us.
- Shut up. I've heard enough.

553
01:03:01,177 --> 01:03:03,168
- Please listen.
- Shut up!

554
01:03:14,190 --> 01:03:17,853
There has to be an explanation
of this somewhere.

555
01:03:24,534 --> 01:03:26,866
Explain this.

556
01:03:46,222 --> 01:03:50,886
John, I'm so sorry.
I never meant to hurt you.

557
01:03:51,227 --> 01:03:53,889
I don't know why I did it.
I wish I could take it all back.

558
01:03:54,230 --> 01:03:57,563
No. Emma, you didn't do it.

559
01:03:57,900 --> 01:03:59,891
This affair of yours, the thing you're
supposed to have done...

560
01:04:00,169 --> 01:04:04,162
- You didn't do it.
- What do you mean?

561
01:04:04,841 --> 01:04:06,502
I know this is gonna sound crazy...

562
01:04:07,176 --> 01:04:10,407
but what if we never
knew each other before now?

563
01:04:10,513 --> 01:04:14,415
What if the first time
we ever met was last night...

564
01:04:14,517 --> 01:04:16,849
in your...
in our apartment...

565
01:04:17,186 --> 01:04:22,522
and everything that I'm supposed
to remember never really happened.

566
01:04:22,859 --> 01:04:25,521
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

567
01:04:26,195 --> 01:04:28,425
But how can that be true?

568
01:04:28,531 --> 01:04:31,523
I so vividly
remember meeting you.

569
01:04:32,535 --> 01:04:35,527
I remember falling
in love with you.

570
01:04:36,539 --> 01:04:38,871
I remember losing you.

571
01:04:41,210 --> 01:04:42,541
No, wait, wait.

572
01:04:42,879 --> 01:04:46,212
Please...
just one more minute.

573
01:04:52,221 --> 01:04:54,553
I love you, John.

574
01:04:57,560 --> 01:05:01,826
You can't fake
something like that.

575
01:05:31,861 --> 01:05:34,193
Inspector? Sir?

576
01:05:35,531 --> 01:05:38,523
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

577
01:05:40,536 --> 01:05:42,868
I kind of thought you should know.

578
01:05:44,874 --> 01:05:47,536
The chief wanted to see you.

579
01:05:48,544 --> 01:05:50,205
Sir...

580
01:05:56,218 --> 01:05:58,880
I knew you'd track
the killer down, sir.

581
01:06:10,499 --> 01:06:12,160
Sir...

582
01:06:13,836 --> 01:06:15,497
shoelace.

583
01:06:28,184 --> 01:06:31,517
- How can we help you, sir?
- You can sleep.

584
01:06:34,190 --> 01:06:37,182
- Sleep.
- Sleep.

585
01:06:40,196 --> 01:06:42,187
Evening, sir.

586
01:06:53,876 --> 01:06:57,869
I want to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

587
01:07:00,149 --> 01:07:03,812
- Take us to Murdoch.
- Sleep.

588
01:07:31,514 --> 01:07:35,746
- Dr. Schreber.
- I knew you'd come eventually.

589
01:07:35,851 --> 01:07:38,513
Don't you think it's about time
you started giving me some answers?

590
01:07:39,522 --> 01:07:42,514
Yes. Won't you please sit down?

591
01:07:45,528 --> 01:07:50,192
I come here often. It's one of the few
places I'm allowed a moment's peace.

592
01:07:50,533 --> 01:07:53,866
You see, they have
an aversion to... water.

593
01:07:54,870 --> 01:07:56,861
One could almost call it a phobia.

594
01:07:57,206 --> 01:07:59,868
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

595
01:08:00,142 --> 01:08:01,473
Right.

596
01:08:01,811 --> 01:08:05,804
For now, let's just say that you were
the subject of their experiment.

597
01:08:06,482 --> 01:08:08,143
We all are.

598
01:08:09,485 --> 01:08:11,476
I'm sorry about this.
I truly am.

599
01:08:11,821 --> 01:08:15,484
But we don't have much time and I can't
afford doing this the right way.

600
01:08:15,825 --> 01:08:19,158
Everything you need to know, all the
answers, are in this syringe.

601
01:08:19,495 --> 01:08:23,158
I need you to inject yourself. It's the
only way to make you understand.

602
01:08:23,499 --> 01:08:26,059
- You're kidding me, right?
- We're running out of time.

603
01:08:26,168 --> 01:08:29,831
- You have to do this now.
- Give me the gun, doctor.

604
01:08:30,172 --> 01:08:32,163
Inspector, he is more
disturbed than we thought.

605
01:08:32,508 --> 01:08:35,068
I may not be the judge
of personality...

606
01:08:35,177 --> 01:08:37,839
but you're the one
who looks disturbed to me.

607
01:08:38,848 --> 01:08:41,180
You do not know what you are doing.

608
01:08:41,851 --> 01:08:45,514
What, exactly
is in this, doctor?

609
01:08:47,189 --> 01:08:50,522
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

610
01:08:52,528 --> 01:08:58,194
Guess I'll just have to hold onto
it for safekeeping...

611
01:08:58,534 --> 01:09:00,468
Let's go, doctor.

612
01:09:01,137 --> 01:09:04,470
Go? Where are we going?

613
01:09:04,807 --> 01:09:06,798
Shell Beach.

614
01:09:07,810 --> 01:09:09,801
That's where you want to go, isn't it?

615
01:09:10,146 --> 01:09:11,807
The ocean.

616
01:09:19,822 --> 01:09:22,814
You won't find anything there.
I've been there, and...

617
01:09:23,159 --> 01:09:25,491
If you've been there you can show
us the way, can't you?

618
01:09:25,828 --> 01:09:29,161
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there!

619
01:09:29,498 --> 01:09:32,160
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

620
01:09:40,843 --> 01:09:44,176
I don't understand.
Used to be a bridge here.

621
01:09:51,187 --> 01:09:54,179
Try that again, your friends are gonna
be fishing you out of the canal.

622
01:09:54,523 --> 01:09:57,185
Just don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

623
01:10:04,533 --> 01:10:06,194
What?

624
01:10:08,871 --> 01:10:10,862
Who are you people?

625
01:10:11,207 --> 01:10:14,199
Let's go. End of the canal.

626
01:10:15,211 --> 01:10:19,545
We will give you some more pretty
things soon... Anna.

627
01:10:20,216 --> 01:10:21,877
I'm not Anna.

628
01:10:23,219 --> 01:10:25,210
You will be soon, yes.

629
01:10:29,558 --> 01:10:31,890
I have another use
for her first.

630
01:10:41,237 --> 01:10:43,467
I call them... the Strangers.

631
01:10:43,572 --> 01:10:46,234
They abducted us
and brought us here.

632
01:10:47,243 --> 01:10:49,234
The city, everyone in it...

633
01:10:50,246 --> 01:10:53,238
is their experiment.
They mix and match our memories...

634
01:10:53,582 --> 01:10:57,245
as they see fit, trying to divine
what makes us unique.

635
01:10:57,586 --> 01:11:00,180
One day, a man
might be an inspector.

636
01:11:00,522 --> 01:11:03,514
The next, someone
entirely different.

637
01:11:03,859 --> 01:11:05,520
When they want
to study a murder...

638
01:11:06,862 --> 01:11:10,855
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality...

639
01:11:11,533 --> 01:11:15,526
arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

640
01:11:16,205 --> 01:11:20,198
even a lost wallet.
Then they observe the results.

641
01:11:21,210 --> 01:11:25,544
Will a man, given the history of
a killer continue in that vein?

642
01:11:25,881 --> 01:11:29,783
Or are we, in fact more than
the mere sum of our memories?

643
01:11:29,885 --> 01:11:34,219
This business of you being
a killer was an unhappy coincidence.

644
01:11:34,890 --> 01:11:37,222
You have had dozens
of lives before now.

645
01:11:37,559 --> 01:11:41,222
You just happened to wake up
while I was imprinting you...

646
01:11:41,897 --> 01:11:43,888
Why are they doing all of this?

647
01:11:44,233 --> 01:11:47,896
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

648
01:11:48,237 --> 01:11:51,570
that makes us different from them.
They think they can find...

649
01:11:51,907 --> 01:11:55,240
the human soul if they understand
how our memories work.

650
01:11:55,577 --> 01:11:59,240
All they have are collective memories.
They share one group mind.

651
01:11:59,915 --> 01:12:04,181
They're dying. Their entire race
is on the brink of extinction.

652
01:12:04,853 --> 01:12:06,753
They think we can save them.

653
01:12:06,855 --> 01:12:09,517
- Where do I fit in?
- You are different, John.

654
01:12:09,858 --> 01:12:12,850
You resisted my attempt
to imprint you.

655
01:12:17,533 --> 01:12:20,764
Somehow you have developed
their ability to tune.

656
01:12:20,869 --> 01:12:24,100
That is how they change things.
That is how they built this city.

657
01:12:24,206 --> 01:12:27,107
They have machines very deep
beneath the surface...

658
01:12:27,209 --> 01:12:31,202
that allow them to focus their
telepathic energies.

659
01:12:31,547 --> 01:12:33,879
They control everything here...
even the sun.

660
01:12:34,216 --> 01:12:37,208
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

661
01:12:37,553 --> 01:12:40,545
- So why do they need you?
- When they first brought us here...

662
01:12:40,889 --> 01:12:44,882
they extracted what was in us.
So they could store the information...

663
01:12:45,227 --> 01:12:49,561
remix it like so much paint
and give us back new memories.

664
01:12:49,898 --> 01:12:53,891
But they still needed
an artist to help them.

665
01:12:55,237 --> 01:12:58,229
I understood the intricacies
of the human mind...

666
01:12:58,574 --> 01:13:00,735
better than they ever could...

667
01:13:00,843 --> 01:13:04,176
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist.

668
01:13:04,513 --> 01:13:07,505
But they made me
delete everything else.

669
01:13:15,858 --> 01:13:20,192
Can you imagine what it is like
being forced to erase your own past?

670
01:13:20,529 --> 01:13:23,191
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

671
01:13:24,199 --> 01:13:26,861
Shell Beach, uncle Karl.

672
01:13:27,536 --> 01:13:29,197
What about this?

673
01:13:30,205 --> 01:13:33,868
- This was blank when I found it!
- You still don't understand.

674
01:13:34,209 --> 01:13:37,110
You were never a boy...
not in this place.

675
01:13:37,212 --> 01:13:41,876
Your entire history is an illusion
as it is with all of us.

676
01:13:42,217 --> 01:13:44,777
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

677
01:13:44,887 --> 01:13:46,878
You say they brought
us here.

678
01:13:48,223 --> 01:13:49,554
From where?

679
01:13:53,228 --> 01:13:54,559
I'm sorry.

680
01:13:55,230 --> 01:13:59,223
I don't remember.
None of us remember that...

681
01:13:59,902 --> 01:14:02,837
what we once were...
what we might have been...

682
01:14:03,839 --> 01:14:05,830
somewhere else.

683
01:14:22,858 --> 01:14:26,191
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

684
01:14:26,528 --> 01:14:27,859
Let's go.

685
01:15:13,175 --> 01:15:15,837
There is no ocean, John.

686
01:15:16,512 --> 01:15:19,174
There is nothing beyond the city.

687
01:15:20,516 --> 01:15:22,507
The only "home" exists...

688
01:15:25,187 --> 01:15:27,178
in your head.

689
01:15:35,864 --> 01:15:38,526
John, stop!

690
01:15:52,214 --> 01:15:53,545
Please! No!

691
01:16:14,169 --> 01:16:16,831
And now you
know the truth.

692
01:17:15,831 --> 01:17:20,495
Surrender, or it will result in
this one's death, yes?

693
01:17:20,836 --> 01:17:23,828
What do I care?
She's not my real wife!

694
01:17:24,172 --> 01:17:27,505
- She's nothing to me!
- But you do still care...

695
01:17:27,843 --> 01:17:29,504
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

696
01:17:29,845 --> 01:17:33,838
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

697
01:17:35,517 --> 01:17:39,180
Shall I end her life now
as you would have?

698
01:17:42,524 --> 01:17:44,424
Don't hurt her,
please!

699
01:17:44,526 --> 01:17:47,859
Then surrender,
Mr. Murdoch.

700
01:17:49,865 --> 01:17:51,526
Sleep.

701
01:17:53,535 --> 01:17:55,196
Now.

702
01:18:13,488 --> 01:18:14,819
Sleep.

703
01:18:23,165 --> 01:18:25,156
Kill him.

704
01:18:36,845 --> 01:18:38,506
He is powerful, yes.

705
01:18:39,181 --> 01:18:43,174
Dangerous. But he can also
lead us to what we seek.

706
01:18:43,518 --> 01:18:46,851
What the doctor
calls the soul.

707
01:18:47,189 --> 01:18:50,522
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

708
01:18:50,859 --> 01:18:53,191
We no longer need
the other subjects.

709
01:18:53,528 --> 01:18:56,190
The time for study is over.

710
01:18:57,199 --> 01:19:01,465
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

711
01:19:08,477 --> 01:19:11,469
It is time, doctor. Imprint.

712
01:19:14,483 --> 01:19:16,144
Shut it down!

713
01:19:17,486 --> 01:19:20,148
Shut it down forever!

714
01:19:34,169 --> 01:19:37,502
- What are you doing?
- They want to imprint you...

715
01:19:38,173 --> 01:19:40,835
with their own
collective memories.

716
01:19:41,843 --> 01:19:43,834
They want to make you
one of them...

717
01:19:44,179 --> 01:19:48,172
so they can share your soul.
But I've got other plans.

718
01:19:52,187 --> 01:19:54,849
Imprint, doctor.
No more disobedience.

719
01:19:55,190 --> 01:19:59,524
I'm sorry, John. The pain will
only last a moment or two.

720
01:20:10,872 --> 01:20:12,863
Remember, John.

721
01:20:13,875 --> 01:20:17,868
You'll rise to greater
heights than that, my boy.

722
01:20:21,883 --> 01:20:24,545
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

723
01:20:24,886 --> 01:20:27,787
Remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

724
01:20:27,889 --> 01:20:29,550
John, remember.

725
01:20:30,225 --> 01:20:32,557
You're wondering why I keep
appearing in your memories.

726
01:20:32,894 --> 01:20:34,885
I have inserted myself in them.

727
01:20:35,230 --> 01:20:39,132
Only these memories have been fabricated
to teach you about the strangers.

728
01:20:39,234 --> 01:20:42,226
Give you a lifetime of
knowledge in a single syringe.

729
01:20:45,240 --> 01:20:46,901
You will survive, John.

730
01:20:47,909 --> 01:20:51,572
You will find strength within
yourself and you will prevail.

731
01:20:52,581 --> 01:20:53,912
Remember.

732
01:20:54,249 --> 01:20:55,910
Hi, uncle Karl.

733
01:20:59,588 --> 01:21:03,854
You're getting the hang of it. Maybe
one day I'll be working for you.

734
01:21:04,192 --> 01:21:07,855
This is the machine the strangers
use to amplify their thoughts.

735
01:21:08,196 --> 01:21:09,754
The machine that changes their world.

736
01:21:09,865 --> 01:21:12,857
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

737
01:21:13,201 --> 01:21:14,862
I know you can beat them, John.

738
01:21:15,203 --> 01:21:17,535
But you must concentrate.

739
01:21:19,541 --> 01:21:21,532
Something's wrong.

740
01:21:29,217 --> 01:21:31,447
There is no time for romance, John.

741
01:21:31,553 --> 01:21:33,885
The world can be
what you make it.

742
01:21:34,222 --> 01:21:35,883
What have you done?

743
01:21:36,224 --> 01:21:40,558
You have the power to make
anything happen but you must act now!

744
01:26:24,846 --> 01:26:28,509
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

745
01:26:28,850 --> 01:26:31,182
- You control their machines.
- Where's Emma?

746
01:26:32,520 --> 01:26:36,513
She is not Emma anymore, John.
She has been reimprinted.

747
01:26:36,858 --> 01:26:39,190
- So give her back her memories.
- I can't.

748
01:26:39,527 --> 01:26:43,190
The facility where the strangers
stored the memories has been destroyed.

749
01:26:44,199 --> 01:26:45,530
I'm sorry.

750
01:26:46,534 --> 01:26:48,195
What are you going to do now, John?

751
01:26:51,539 --> 01:26:53,200
I'm gonna fix things.

752
01:26:54,542 --> 01:26:57,534
You told me I had
the power, didn't you?

753
01:26:58,880 --> 01:27:01,474
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

754
01:27:02,817 --> 01:27:04,808
Make this world anything
I want it to be.

755
01:27:06,154 --> 01:27:09,817
Just as long as I
concentrate hard enough.

756
01:28:34,175 --> 01:28:35,836
Where are you going?

757
01:28:38,513 --> 01:28:40,174
Shell Beach.

758
01:29:21,155 --> 01:29:23,146
- What's the fare?
- Quarter.

759
01:29:29,497 --> 01:29:31,829
Oh, please.
I stand aside.

760
01:29:32,500 --> 01:29:33,831
Thank you.

761
01:30:13,875 --> 01:30:15,206
John...

762
01:30:19,213 --> 01:30:22,876
been waiting for you, yes?
What are you doing?

763
01:30:23,217 --> 01:30:26,118
I'm just making a few little
changes around here is all.

764
01:30:26,220 --> 01:30:30,884
- Are we sure that's what we want?
- I'm prepared to take my chances.

765
01:30:31,225 --> 01:30:32,886
I'm dying, John.

766
01:30:33,227 --> 01:30:36,560
Your imprint is not
agreeable with my kind.

767
01:30:36,898 --> 01:30:39,230
But I wanted to know
what it was like...

768
01:30:40,902 --> 01:30:45,236
- How you feel.
- You know how I was supposed to feel.

769
01:30:45,573 --> 01:30:48,906
That person isn't me.
Never was.

770
01:30:49,577 --> 01:30:52,569
You wanted to know what it was
about us that made us human.

771
01:30:53,915 --> 01:30:57,248
You're not going to find it... in here.

772
01:30:59,587 --> 01:31:02,181
You went looking in the wrong place.

773
01:32:40,555 --> 01:32:42,216
It's so beautiful here.

774
01:32:47,562 --> 01:32:49,553
So bright.

775
01:32:55,236 --> 01:33:00,503
- Shell Beach is around here?
- I think that's it over there.

776
01:33:18,859 --> 01:33:20,850
I'm headed that way myself.

777
01:33:22,863 --> 01:33:24,524
Would you like to join me?

778
01:33:27,201 --> 01:33:28,532
Sure.

779
01:33:33,874 --> 01:33:35,535
I'm Anna, by the way.

780
01:33:36,210 --> 01:33:38,542
- What's your name?
- John.

781
01:33:40,881 --> 01:33:42,872
John Murdoch.
